item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Building works blocking road with no way to signal which way traffic has right of way, 26th February
item.description:
There currently building works going on here, which has splitted out to the road meaning the left lane is closed (northwards). TFL have diverted buses going southbound from this road. Yet other traffic southbound is allowed down. There is nothing here to dictate which direct direction has right of way. This causes congestion and bit delays as car, vans and lorrys both try to get through at the same time. As well as cyclists riding through in both directions. I commute through here by bus in the mornings and the bus is often standstill for ages while traffic gets through. But today was just a complete standstill for 10 minutes as a lorry that was part of the building works completely blocked the road. It eventually went through but only after mounting the pavement which was busy with pedestrians to squeeze through. This causes massive congestion during in already busy rush hour traffic. This was also dangerous for cyclists and pedestrians trying to get through. If the building works need the full road traffic should be diverted. If they completely block a lane there should be something there to dictate who has right of way. This is absolutely ridiculous and causing danger for road users. I have a photo to show it was a van connected to the building works but haven't included since it has identifiable information.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Moorgate, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
